cPoGIEGDAGpMuGHJkAAc5w.text: I love Postinos. I have been to everyone in the Valley. The consistency of food, service, people, atmosphere, and overall branding is awesome.   The $5 wines are obviously a hit. The food is on point and everyone is enjoying themselves.   Recently I have sat at the bar to get food and drinks. Derek is one of the bar tenders and he remembered me from the last time I was here. This is so paramount in my opinion because it's about service. They see hundreds of people a day and for someone to remember you only after seeing you one time is pretty impressive. As a patron it makes me feel like I'm included and part of the game.   I usually get the bruschetta variations and again, consistent and never disappointed in the taste and quality. The staff is super nice. I also worked while I was sitting here and to have a wifi connection is big. Thank you for that.   Overall great time and enjoy coming here.

NxIFQcELa7XfvbozHJ4EDQ.text: BACKGROUND Well, let me just say that Postino owners, the DeMarco couple and Bailey couple, co-owner's of LGO Hospitality sure have a grip on restaurants AND social media. As per usual, I'm never oblivious to social media trends and where Yelp sends it's minions, and it's no accident they've been sent to all of the LGO Hospitality venues (including Chelsea's Kitchen and Buck & Rider) and all of five of the Postino's. It's due to the fantastic vision of it's co-owner Craig DeMarco. Craig DeMarco is responsible for some of the Valley's best restaurants, including Postino, Windsor and Federal Pizza. As founding partner of Upward Projects, he, along with founding members Kris DeMarco (Craig's wife) and Wyatt and Lauren Bailey, have brought a dozen restaurant projects to the Valley. Their passion re-purposing classic Valley buildings and invigorating neighborhoods, such as North Central Phoenix, Arcadia and downtown Gilbert has not gone unnoticed. They're killing it and I am a fan. THE STORY & SERVICE EXPERIENCE When I first visited Postino's Highland 10 months ago, I IMMEDIATELY LOVED it. This location is my favorite, although I also love the ASU location. It's just cool and sexy. I feel happy here. I've been all different times of day and night, and it's just fun. My last visit, I went with my BFF Whitney. We shared one of their bruschetta boards and had some wine. I've tried almost everything on the menu, and I've never had a bad meal. The offerings seem simplistic but have a sophistication and maturity to them. The wine list and draft beer selection is impressive. And the service is ALWAYS on point. CONCLUSION Does it seem like I'm promoting Postino's Highland? Well, yes, I am. That's because I'm very selective and I can't find anything bad to say. Isn't that what Yelp is for? To promote businesses that we've enjoyed? 4/5 RECOMMEND OF NOTE *Plenty of parking out front. *For more information: postinowinecafe.com

Wine picks: Last August Sauvignon Blanc and Stagedive Pinot Noir. Fun bar situation here too!

ZYw9LV9h0WEhAS3LBOXu7w.text: I can't say enough good things about Postino. As far as locations go, I think this might be my favorite!!  This location is special because it has an awesome indoor/outdoor area and is larger than some of the others, which I love.   If this is your first time trying Postino, you MUST try the bruschetta. It is out of this world. I've been to a couple of different other places that seem as if they are trying to copy Postino's bruschetta, but it is never as good.   Aside from the bruschetta, the salads are wonderful, all of them, my favorite being the italian picnic. The cheese board is also amazing.   Most importantly, the wine is amazing at Postino. If you are not sure which to try, ALWAYS try the Postino exclusive. It will never let you down. All the locations except for Gilbert will let you take home an unfinished bottle which is really nice also. Even better, on Mondays and Tuesdays if you come at 8pm they have their special - any bottle of wine AND a tray of bruschetta for $20! It cannot be beat!!

I am so impressed with how well your company hires because this food was phenomenal   Thank you Garrett!

All in all, a dependable and delicious option.

sqzTp3AiyzmGALkX_XZobQ.text: I came here with a few friends to begin our Saturday evening. The most one person in our group drank was 3 glasses of wine. We were approached by the manager towards closing time. She said that she was coming by our table to assure that none of us were driving and asked if we needed a cab called.... We told her no, that we were fine, but also asked if we seemed like we were drunk. She replied, "There are some signs of intoxication over here, yes."   I'm sorry- but we are all grown adults who were not being eccentric or wild- just laughing, chatting, and having a couple of drinks. It was completely demeaning and embarrassing that the manager would accuse us of being intoxicated. Even if we were, that is not how you treat your guests.... Especially when we were literally the only table of patrons on that side of the restaurant. I've been to other Postinos locations that I have enjoyed, but this one left a very bad taste in my mouth.

z0YEyzVbmgDTB8LKBnBY3g.text: I love Postinos. Awesome happy hours! My daughter goes to school at ASU and this is the first place we go after she picks me up at the airport. It kicks off our mother/ daughter weekends perfectly. The do have gluten free bread so if you have restrictions you still have the same options as every one. For $16.75 (gluten free version) you get a board with 4 delicious options. Love the smoked salmon one and the fig one. I always get those two then experiment a little for the other two. Great wine selection, good beer selection ( try the Kilt Lifter if visiting from out of town. You will be begging your local beer spot to carry it) and a very relaxing environment. fdu9i4cJRJGGGn3TQjbhow.text: This is an excellent restaurant. The food is spectacular and all fresh ingredients. It's very clear the chef and his team love what they do. The manager, Raul, and his wait staff are stellar. They have an excellent wine list and their prices are surprisingly reasonable. This will definitely be one of our go-to restaurants, especially with guests who are visiting in from out of town.

BWtsjqIwKMq2aov8-17X2w.text: I was in town visiting my fiance's parents and his mom and I had an appointment at Sachi Salon. We got there about an hour early to hopefully enjoy some breakfast. It was about 11 AM on a Sunday morning which is usually, primetime brunch. We got a parking spot in the lot and we noticed Postino. At first, it looked closed from the outside. I opened my Yelp and it said it was open for brunch. We walked over there and it was totally open. Not only open, but there were seats available and no wait. It was meant to be! We were approached by our server, young girl and not super friendly but got our coffees right away for us. I noticed later that they had a French press and I wish that I had ordered that. The coffee was delicious, though. They don't come by and refill it for you, you have to ask. I ordered the 2 egg breakfast with my eggs poached, which they said they don't do poached eggs but rather based eggs, which I had never heard of and actually prefer, they were very good. It came with bacon and cranberry walnut toast and I ordered a side of avocado. The toast was absolutely delicious and it came on a beautiful board with a great presentation. My fiance's mother ordered the grilled focaccia bread which came with eggs with a side of fruit. Hers looked delicious as well. The food came out in a fairly quick time span and our server started growing on us, or us on her! The overall decor was really cool as it is advertised as a wine bar. I wonder what the night environment is like. I'm so excited that we were able to find this place and enjoy breakfast so last minute. It was convenient, the prices were affordable too high given the area we were in.

FrQlLap5HbE4GI6i-g-1_A.text: What a great happy hour on very good wines (11-5- $5/ glass ) and lunch specials of a "pick two" for $11.00. The outdoor patio area is also spacious and great for a breezy AZ spring day. Overall we had a nice lunch here as everything tasted good and my friend was satisfied with her wine and pick two meal. Mine started out great from walking in to Postinos and being acknowledged by several hosts/waiters. However as soon we we were seated outdoors the service got a bit spotty. (Understanding it was around 12 with the lunch hour rush) I had ordered tea and while I was brought a mug with a selection of teas, they had forgotten to bring out the hot water pot for quite a while. This also happened for the bruschetta I ordered so sadly I had nearly finished my salad when the one bruschetta was brought out.   So I highly recommend Postinos but possibly outside of the lunch rush hour! I'd also recommend to Postinos to have a "pick two" where one bruschetta could be one of the options you could pick as part of your combo.

p3jkkDYUHvqrOaRen_sukQ.text: Definitely a great spot to grab a snack or lunch. They have $5 beer pitchers or wine everyday before 5! Definitely come and have a good time! Got in for a late lunch snack and sat outside. It was nice because they had the heat lamps going.   We went with the bruschetta of course. My favorite two are the Brie and Apple & fig spread and the ricotta with dates and & pistachios. They are both so delicious paired with wine. The Brie is so smooth and it pairs with the sweet fig spread sooo well. The sandwich was ok but the salad was nice. You definitely cannot go wrong with the bruschetta.

At night they have the fireplace going, which is so cozy if it's a little chilly out.

IARdJr2wQrTFjcUGfgEKwg.text: Had a great pre-dinner. Wonderful apps, $5 wine, and great service. My mom was in town from NJ, and she loved it as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Highland - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Butcher board and veggie board !

e9r56tnMOxSHc6_LilCZLw.text: Lovely ambience, friendly staff, a great place a romantic dinner especially if you can get a seat outside, which on an average takes 45 min to an hour wait! Make sure to notice the deco, its very interesting.  Wish there was more vegetarian options, or at least more deserts. But the cauliflower with home made sauce and the chocolate based dessert was very tasty.  Definitely a must visit, more so since they are spread over more than 1 area.

MoVYgu1BdsRhIX4hwlj_XA.text: Holy moly this place was fantastic! Unfortunately we didn't stumble upon this place until the last day of our long weekend stay. And it was right around the corner from our AirBnB, bummer! Our first and only visit was so worth it!   Postino has an incredible happy hour that we took advantage of: $5 glass of wine or pitcher of beer until 5pm. They have an incredible selection of wine to fit anyone's tastes. Another amazing special: $20 for a bottle of wine and a bruschetta board on Mondays and Tuesdays after 8pm.   Of course we couldn't just drink rose all afternoon so we ordered the Butcher's Block and four bruschetta breads. They do not skimp on the meat and cheese plate like other places might. I hate when I order a charcuterie board and there's two pieces of cheese and a slice of ham. At Postino they load that board up. They were also nice enough to bring us more bread without charging us. Now onto the different bruschetta: these were so delicious! We got the spinach artichoke, smoked salmon, Brie & apples, and a seasonal that had a crap ton of bacon it-- no complaints here.   My only complaint is that there isn't a Postino in KC! This would definitely be one of my go to happy hour spots.

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Highland - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bruschetta from top to bottom: spinach artichoke, smoked salmon, seasonal bacon, Brie and apple.
Photo of Postino Highland - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The Butchers Block.
Photo of Postino Highland - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

vuBAa1C-dgKFCPQqCWtZ_w.text: My partner and I took a birthday trip to Scottsdale and were looking for a quick bite and a glass of wine before we went out and all of the reviews for this location were excellent and the menu looked great. We were absolutely not disappointed, as everything was not only delicious but the staff was extremely friendly. We so enjoyed ourselves that we went a second time before we left to return home, and the management recognized us and came over to chat with us about our vacation. Very wonderful on all levels, we will be going again when my partner graduates from ASU in the spring. Thanks Tim!

T8t0od0hrBYklxCzuvwlrw.text: My very favorite Wine Bar of all time. Been going here for years and it's always great. The atmosphere is chill and everyone is cool. The wine is always awesome. The service is always first rate. When I come here with friends we always leave happy. Highly recommended to everyone.

nej39RUvogiHqSWsYby9NQ.text: Postinos is a Phoenix staple (though they have locations in Houston supposedly too now?). There's quite a few locations, this one is great since it has its own parking lot and is close to fashion square. Inside and outside dining options, bar, regular tables or loungy couches. Soup of the moment was potato leek and very tasty! Did a board with Brie/apple, mozzarella tomato, burrata/bacon, and artichoke. Sooooo good, ample servings!

2wO1Zvg3lPYEQ77WxqwOPg.text: Friendly and cool service- every staff member is your server.  Manager Tim (?)- he wears a St. Jude's Children's Hospital pin as he's a volunteer- is so friendly and sweet, that he sent Mom and me home a couple of weeks ago with a gift to celebrate our new build contract after our realtor treated all of us to a bottle of Moscato d'Asti, a bruschetta board, a Tomato Caprese, and a Butcher's Block.  Came here to have another glass of the sparkling Moscato and a bruschetta board, this time at the bar, with amiable, unobtrusive, and handsome server Bobby.    Had planned to go elsewhere for pizza, but construction kept me from going there, so Postino's it was, and I'm glad I came.  Note to self: Mustn't eat so much-- a gorgeous couple invited me to try their exquisite-looking Grilled cheese app, but I couldn't eat another bite!  Thank you, anyway!

Great bruschetta boards, $5 til 5pm happy hour on wines/champagne and awesome service. Derrick is one of our favorite bartenders go say hi to him! Thanks Postino!

wQScuPElcOiJutAbU44PuQ.text: Tonight was a great night, the place was packed to brim, the energy was high and the staff was on top of it. The food and drinks came out as if the restaurant was empty! Our server Jordan was amazing. I will definitely return very soon.

TBXpEM6a7nK3AaaGmPkljA.text: This is my second time visitng Postinos (different location). I did not have a good experience the first time, but figured I would give this time a try. UGH. I don't know if Management just doesn't staff well, if they are hiring, if they are extremely understaffed? I have no idea what is going on but most of the waiters seemed frazzled. They were overextended in regards to tables they were assisting. I would watch the line of food coming out which seemed to be coming at a reasonable pace and yet it would sit there for up to ten minutes (yes, I legit was timing it) and the whole thing would be full of food orders waiting to be taken to tables and a couple of waiters/waitresses would go up at the same time to only stand there and try to sort through the tickets. We went during dinner time between 5-6 p.m. and the place was full which I am sure it always is, but maybe Corporate should hire more people? Food was good, wine was good, service was unfortunately not. I'm sure I'll be going back at some point in my life, but so far this is my second disappointment.

GmcZPNNS3zcWvq7ei-KsPQ.text: Postino Highland is by far the best Postino in the Valley. Since opening in the spring of 2016, I have been coming here every week. What really sets this Postino apart is the exceptional service and incredible staff. They are the real reason I look forward to coming here. Thank you, Emily, Carlos, Marissa, Brianna, Whitney(s), Tim, Jordan, Raul, McKenna, just to name a few (and of course Chef Ryan and Garret). Sorry if I missed someone but you're all fantastic.

IA_4ACRX4whHNQbgQcHKrg.text: Everything on the menu here is extremely delicious! You can't go wrong with the bruschetta board! (my favorite is the almond hummus and chopped tomatoes) all of the salads and paninis here are yummy too! A really rad thing about this place is they are GF and vegan friendly! The large variety of wine here makes it effortless to pair the perfect glass with my meal. Also the deals here are amazing! $5 glasses of wine and pitchers of beer until 5pm everyday! Not to mention the $20 board of bruschetta and bottle of wine nights on Monday and Tuesday! Postino is easily one of my favorite places to dine

GRweDP0C7QWXchFyyVpS-w.text: Finally decided to try this place out and was more than satisfied! Came on a Sunday and pitchers/wine by glass were 5 bucks each!! Hubby and I got a pitcher of the kilt lifter and then shared a bruschetta and a panini. I didn't expect to be full but it was all more than enough! The bruschetta board was SO good and I can't wait to go back and try more flavor combinations! We tried the tuna panini and it was definitely good! Can't wait to go back and try more! In addition to awesome food, service was pretty good too! No complaints!

fpNFay7DPrZE0SmNbjX0iw.text: A group of us went to Postino's for a light lunch. We told the waiter to choose three Bruschetta boards with a variety of flavors. The boards were perfect. Brie & Apples with Fig Spread, Prosciutto with Figs & Mascarpone, Smoked Salmon with Pesto, Sweet & Spicy Pepper Jam with Goat Cheese (my absolute favorite). Had a great time.

OqchEQGE9SS4CZhJuqXGvg.text: Went with a friend to try the new Fashion Square Postinos. Went with the "Pick Two" half salads half sandwich.  The place is huge, and nice inside. 2kUDP1x-lJcLYHrrFrQRHw.text: I love Postino and I have been a very loyal customer from the early days. Yesterday, I went to the Highland store for the first time. It's not the closest one to me, but I wanted to see what their awesome design team did with this iconic example of Modern Phoenix architecture. I've always loved how Upward Projects repurposes interesting, older buildings for many of their restaurants. This particular building is very special, especially for a modern architecture geek such as myself. The service and food were, as usual, very good. But when I asked the (dreamy) bartender who designed the building, he incorrectly told me Frank Llyod Wright. This building was constructed in 1967 and was designed by Frank Henry who taught at Taliesin West but never met FLW, who died in 1959. Details matter.

eCFDW5sBo7aZ51O2pO0bPw.text: We had a Bridal Shower there Saturday Feb 10th.  It could not have been more perfect.  The staff was so outstanding, the food was wonderful and a good time was had by all.  The Postino staff was on target from the beginning to the end, they made it easy.  Thank you so much!!!

AO4zqlqcqLfZbhgIckCuAw.text: Met a friend who works at the adjacent hair salon  and ordered four selections from the bruschetta menu. Probably in terms of food the standout on the menu. Service started out pretty good and then wandered into the void as the evening progressed  and the place got busier.  They did allow Morris on the patio although there did seem to be some confusion as to whether this was normal policy. If you are going out and your  main interest is socializing than this is a good place. Food is nothing special for the price but decent.

bCVqCT-RlmxKkNI0Q_uRng.text: Love the ambiance and the food is good. Huge fan of the board and bottle special, but haven't been at this location yet (just the tempe location). Service is good, but both times I have gone its been pretty empty and service was really slow (waiter even forgot to put in our brunch order once and we finally asked where our food was after 40 minutes). But over all its a great place!

UfFbgL9PvFpdEPNAaPUxpQ.text: The food and drinks are great but the manager on duty at 1115am this Friday was very unaccommodating. As much as I enjoy this place, that was REALLY disappointing.

nV_vgYwnlOwZjCl26guXSQ.text: Much love! Great friendly service and wonderful compilations of different tasty treats! Even our kids loved it! It has more parking than the other Postino's and a great wine list.

4oUUZEQqqUjaV31VqgpIow.text: No Instagram filter is needed for pictures at Postino's. It lets off a vibe that seeps into your pictures that create a sense of unreal happiness that will make all your buds jealous.  Whenever I go here, say: for quick munch with friends after work; during the middle of the day for a rejuvenating mimosa; or even at night when I want a balance between romantic atmosphere and a crowd with a reservoir energy if things were to pop off - Postino's is always able to make each experience worthwhile.  It's quite spacious inside, but there may be issues with parking because Postino is one hot tamale in ol'Scottsdale. Once your inside though, the staff has perfected the customer service deal. Courteous in asking you how your day was, but cognizant that you want a seat quickly so you can get down to your business.  Every order I have gotten here has been solid. I typically go for the board of meats that starts with a C. I called it my Charizard plate because I can't remember the name of it and I feel like a Pokemon would relish the taste and the large portions they serve. But regardless of the name, you're gonna wanna imbibe as many fluids(alcohol) as possible with your meals to make the experience perfect.  This place is a solid high five.

QoxjcFL52fRVBDiZqCwdcg.text: Postino's daily happy hour is AMAZING......  5 dollar glass of wine? YES.  5 dollar pitcher of beer? YES!  Many AZ local beers? YES!!  Perfect for some young adults to enjoy an early happy hour with delish appetizers.  Highly recommend the meat kabobs!

IaqfkYI7w6SaO7f3CKn-Hw.text: I was staying down the street from Postino during a recent business trip to Scottsdale. I wondered in for a late lunch and stumbled upon the $5 before 5PM wine special. I sat at the bar and quickly realized there were many a regular there to take advantage of the deal.  The wine list was solid, and at $5 a glass was a real value.  For food I ordered the grilled cheese and tomato/mozzarella. The portion of the grille cheese was large! Three sandwiches came out on the board with a variety of sauces. The bread was fresh and tasty but the sandwiches were a little skimpy on the cheese.  The tomatoes and mozzarella were perfect. Great flavor and presentation.  Perfect sized portion.  Service at the bar was solid. I got enough attention without feeling bothered.   Overall the experience was pretty good. It got me out of the hotel without needing an Uber or walking to far in the crazy AZ heat. The biggest criticism I have is the ambience. The decor felt dated (think late 70s/early 80s). A facelift (and more cheese on the grilled cheese) would do wonders for Postino.

3CvqmTxcdfp-rVW6T4ximA.text: I LOVE Postinos and I especially LOVE Postinos brunch menu! They serve it only on the weekends (every Saturday and Sunday from 9am-1pm). I used to come to Postino so often for lunch and dinner, I had no idea they had breakfast until Snooze was too busy and we saw Postino was open (that was down at the Annex location) but since then, I find myself coming more often for the brunch menu since it's such a treat.   They still offer their gluten-free bread for any of the breakfast options. I usually get the Morning Staple (eggs, potatoes, bacon, and toast--served with a delicious berry jam) but I decided to try the Farm Scramble instead (served with eggs, potatoes, onions, tomatoes, and a salad). It was delicious and a total mix of sweet (from the salad dressing and tomatoes) to savory (from the cheese and eggs). My date got the B.E.L.T (which is a breakfast panini with bacon, eggs, lettuce, and tomatoes!)   I'm just OBSESSED by how unique and flavorful the items are. They take regular breakfast foods but elevate it by adding in extra seasoning and ingredients that enhances the flavor. Let's just say, the food is NEVER boring! They even have breakfast tea (my FAVORITE is the herbal with mint). If you're a Postino's fan, you have to check out their brunch!

Photo of Postino Highland - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Farm Scramble

AO2TwuxP1-wq1FSvOM0IFQ.text: I love this place! During my quick trip to Scottsdale recently this place was recommended to me by a staff member of the hotel where I was staying just a few blocks down. Mind you the hotel I was staying at had its own restaurant and eating options, but yet they recommended this place to me, so I figure that's a good sign!  I came for lunch and was immediately greeted at the door. The place had just opened up and they mentioned they have a wine list for $5 wines. Although it wasn't even noon yet, I said what the heck! It's 5:00 somewhere right?!  I had my phone and charger in hand so my server asked if I wanted to sit near an outlet. Yeah of course I do. Thank you for that - when the little things are big things. I had just gotten off a long flight and needed to charge my phone.  I ordered the chicken mozzarella panini and it was quite filling for lunch and the wine was nice after my long flight from Baltimore.  The place got packed pretty quickly and I can see why. I really enjoyed my visit here.   I chatted with my server a bit and he mentioned that they are bringing one of these to DC in the near future. I can't wait!

5sqbDi3hQ11aChcP74au8A.text: We've been to all of Postino's locations. The two best ones are in Phoenix and Scottsdale. The Phoenix has the garden/patio feel. The Scottsdale has the indoor/outdoor feel. Service is always spot on. We came here to get something in our stomach before scope out new places in Old Town. We ordered Hannah's salad with additional chicken skewer and smoked salmon. Salad was small for an active guy. The smoked salmon was too salty so capers were pushed to the side. It really needed more pickled sides to balance it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Highland - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hannah&#39;s with additional chicken skewer
Photo of Postino Highland - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Smoked salmon, had better but still good

TyuXmqOfse-KzK9EOobp8w.text: When I first arrived, the place was crowded. It must be because the food at Postinos is so good! I gave the person my name and number so she could text me when a table opened up for me and my friends.   After we were seated, we ordered some bruschetta and wine. I really liked the bruschetta. I have visited a Postinos a long time ago, but I don't really remember what I had before. This time when I tried the food it was so amazing that I want to go back.  I had several of the bruschettas, but the ones that I really liked was the Brie, apple, and fig spread bruschetta. The next time I go, I want to also try the prosciutto di Parma, fig, and mascarpone bruschetta. I'd like to have the warm artichoke spread too. The smoked salmon and pesto sounds great. The salami pesto sounds ok too. I know I tried at least four different flavors, but they just weren't as good as my favorite one.

Fv0dnrpxQPazKKtBhgKWRw.text: Most people come here for the bruschetta. I have yet to try that, but it sure looks good. Instead, I had a kale salad and my other half had a duo of salad & soup. I also added chicken skewers which was one note: seasoned strictly with salt. Blah. (A little herb would've been great though on my chicken--- Please... ). And my salad was pretty small in quantity, in my opinion. But it was tasty. My partner's soup was delicious and so was her salad.   I can't wait to come back to try some different offerings and maybe even happy hour drinks.  The ambiance inside and out is very appealing; the bar area as well! It's certainly a do over for me.

OoVC2z_RVEFgk-8E_77NHQ.text: I was in town for the weekend on a girl's trip and we decided we couldn't NOT go to Postino's. Running the risk of sounding basic; we decided we had seen too many fabulous Instagram posts about the Bruschetta that we had to try it for ourselves.....   We were seated at a central booth (in the middle of two walkways). After just having placed a rather sizable order for 3 small girls, we were chatting and anxiously awaiting our food. Our appetites quickly dissipated when a fellow patron walked past our table and projectile vomited EVERYWHERE, and then proceeded not to say anything and pretend it didn't happen. It's a dimly lit restaurant with dark floors and we were the only 3 people to see this unfold. I quickly raced to the host stand to fill an employee in on the situation. Before anything could be done 3 waiters simultaneously slipped on the vomit.... as the 'puker' walked past and sat back down at his table pretending nothing ever happened (he quickly there after ran out).   Needless to say it felt like we were either on an episode of candid camera or in the midst or a very, very gross dream. This, of course, was no reflection on the restaurant, but did make it more challenging to enjoy our meal.   Despite having to gag down our food, we were impressed by the bruschetta. Our favorites were the Smoked Salmon & Pesto, Burrata & Bacon, and Brie Apple & Fig. Between 3 people we split a board of 4 bruschetta, a cheese board, and a salad.

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Highland - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

VsovLXiF716AQHkesgtJHg.text: Postino's will always be one of my favorite lunch spots! Their bruschetta is something I'm craving on a random day. They do have other really good food options- good paninis and salads.   We got a bruschetta board. Our choices were (1) Apple/Fig (2) Tomato/Mozz (3) Prosciutto/Masc (4) Bacon/Burrata in order. And we ordered the brussel sprout salad to share. They kindly brought out the salad already split into two bowls, which was a nice touch.   We also ordered a glass of wine each since they had their happy hour going on! It paired well with the bruschetta.   As always, we loved every item! I will come here forever, maybe one day when I become a certified Scottsdale mom.

ft1gCLNdgCPIDj9jyw_MSA.text: First time to this location! The Bottle and Board is such an amazing deal, you can't go wrong or pass it up. You get a bottle of wine and a Bruschetta board (4 different choices by the way).   My wife and I went out on our first date to the Arcadia location. I have since been to the Phoenix location and now Highland. Never disappoints for good food, wine, and atmosphere.   I do need to get better at taking pictures but I get caught up in the moment! Recommend for anyone wanting a good night or day out.

xzFEwyjwIZc5JbcUx_Wzew.text: My friend and I haven't been to this location in awhile. We more so go to the Arcadia location because we are in that area more often. The food is excellent as they are very consistent in all locations,  As I've always reviewed, they have the BEST boards. We ordered the bruschetta board, split a roast beef panini and of course took advantage of the $5 HH Pitcher of Beer.   Atmosphere:Trendy with ample parking, Service: excellent, Food: consistently very good

Photo of Postino Highland - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bruschetta Board

rHLPP1zpiu4xZ2pA7Q49RQ.text: We came for lunch & I'm Celiac so we went with the gluten-free bread for the bruschetta. They didn't put it through the toaster with the regular bread when we asked. It was very good! My choices on the bruschetta were just ok. We went with the 1. prosciutto, fig, mascarpone 2. Dates, pistachios, Ricotta 3. Pepper jam 4. Arugula, bacon, mozzarella. The pepper jam one was the best but the rest we're just so-so.  We also got a half sandwich and salad. I got the gluten-free chicken & mozzarella sandwich and the Brussels sprouts salad. My wife got the tuna sandwich and Brussels sprouts salad as well.  They appeared to be very cautious with all of my gluten-free requests.  Both sandwiches and salads were very good. The Brussels Sprouts salad may have been the best item.  Overall we were very happy with the experience and would say this is a very good option for those out there with Celiacs and need gluten-free.

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Highland - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. From bottom to top : 1. prosciutto, fig, mascarpone 2. Dates &amp; pistachios,  3. Pepper jam 4. Arugula, bacon, mozzarella

E3utCijrSBw2PL9lcUZ93w.text: Always so good and service is always great!  My daughter was in town for a few weeks and we ate here twice!  The wine is great!  The salads and prosciutto boards are exceptional!  A great place for casual dining as well as a classy date night!

JAF53Ehd_2zu4BqTvnH1gg.text: I've eaten here more times than I can count, as well as the Keirland location, and I much prefer this location! I love the feel of this one! It seems warmer & more upscale, with nicer and more booths, & has a huge outdoor dining area with fireplace and heaters. (See photo.)   It's right across from the Optima, by Fashion Square Mall, and their "'table' seating and bar area side" looks out at the beautiful view.   They have awesome deals on wine! Take a look at my photo of "just the wines as you walk in," which is a fraction." Hit them on a wine and bruschetta board night, and the wine pays for itself. 'What a deal. They also have a great beer selection.  The food is always consistent and delicious! My absolute favorite thing to order, for either lunch or dinner, is the half sandwich/ half soup. They have a different soup every day, and some are super unique. The chefs like to keep it switched-up. I've been there when the "soup of the moment" was a spicy andouille sausage minestrone type, a tomato basil (which the other people in my party loved, however I thought that it tasted exactly like a jar of spaghetti sauce). My favorite it ABSOLUTELY their potato leek soup! OMGosh, I could have had 3 bowls of that even though I was stuffed after one (and the "half sandwich.") See the photo of their half sandwich. To me, it's a big portion & same with the soup and salad.  The sandwich that I love is the "Nine Iron" Panini (See photo.) Turkey, bacon, mixed greens lettuce, tomato, and a creamy mayo with a hint of horseradish taste that they call dijonnaise.  If they don't have a soup that sounds appealing, I'll get their signature half salad with my "Nine Iron." The salad has a scoop of chicken salad (that is fantastic, with green apples, almonds, pecans, and it seemed like I had some dried cranberries & maybe peanuts in mine). Trust me people love it!!! The chicken salad is surrounded by beautiful mixed greens topped with a subtle sprinkling gorgonzola crumbles. But, OH that raspberry dressing on the side! Everyone I know goes crazy over it!!! It's  called a raspberry vinaigrette, but I don't taste acidity in it at all. To me, it tastes like a fresh raspberry coulis!  Thus the prices are great.  A half soup/ half sandwich (actually large) and an Arnold Palmer for only $15.   Since I always check the cleanliness for Dining Grades, I took a photo of the cute stack of "P." toilet paper in the clean restroom, the restaurant was also spotless, and the view through the open kitchen made me give them a thumbs-up.  Nick and ALL of the servers who have ever waited on me (or my crew) at this location are just so much more sharp and friendly that at the Keirland location. 'Example, one slick waiter did this cool flip with our credit card landing it into the clip-board clip. And they are fast, super friendly & attentive even when they're packed.  It's just a fun, happenin' place, while at the same time, being warm, and with unique seating areas like the recessed large group area. (Check out my photo.)

y2lV7gjl8xNguITsCubWVw.text: My best friend hosted her welcome reception for her wedding on 1/18 and it was so beautiful! I asked her who she worked with and she said shoutout to Breanna, Brandon, Mark, and Claudia helped and Jackson is the Assistant General Manager!  There were pre-ordered light bites which were delicious and an open bar. It was on their beautiful back patio and they had more than enough outdoor heaters to keep us warm. There was plenty of seating and I loved the outdoor string lights. The boards and bruschetta were so good!

sKxyRENH071rdiZ8VB0q5Q.text: We come to Postino every time we're in Arizona! On our most recent visit, we came to this location twice in one weekend because we love it that much.   $5 wine for happy hour, and the happy hours are long. The bruschetta is some of the most amazing that I've ever had and all the flavors are delicious. My favorites are the salmon pesto, the traditional caprese, and the salami pesto. They also have one bruschetta option that they change up every once in awhile, and on our visit they had the mortadella which was awesome. They switch up the soups daily, and we got the turkey and kale soup. Delicious but so small if you order the cup.   This place is also interior design goals. Such a gorgeous sitting area and indoor/outdoor concept. Perfect location for brunch photos or to even come at night for a drink at the bar (I believe they're open until midnight).  Postino is also surprisingly decently priced for the quality of the food and the atmosphere, imo. It's definitely one of my favorite places to eat in Phoenix and Scottsdale.  Please open up a location in California!

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Highland - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Soup of the day: turkey + kale (it&#39;s literally glistening)
Photo of Postino Highland - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Our bruschetta board (from front to back: mortadella, caprese, salmon pesto, and brie + apples)
Photo of Postino Highland - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

e2h6hIe5qba5gLMZNVPJqw.text: I am not even sure we could come here without having Marc as our server for he was soooooo freaking wonderful! He walked us through the wine menu, made excellent recommendations and was very descriptive in the wine and food.  Can we just take Marc every where with us, we love him!  This is now our new Fav Postino's. The ambience is romantic, cozy, sophisticated yet comfortable.  We felt at home and cannot wait for our next date night due to the excellent service!  Thank you so much Marc, you made our night!

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Highland - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

JougRCDoAv6RW5HE36a1tw.text: LOVED our experience at Postino! My husband and I were visiting Scottsdale for our Anniversary and we had the most amazing meal at Postino! Not only was the food SO yummy but our waitress was incredible! Mckenna was so sweet, she was willing to go out of her way to give us a list of recommendations for the Phoenix area and her service was impeccable! Highly highly recommend this place! :)

rI0ZuIx_bysuemQ4KKCRZQ.text: Happy Hour $5 everyday til 5pm, and the best bruschetta I've had...enough said. Happy hour includes about 8 beers on draft, and $5 gets you a whole pitcher. I think the breakdown is less than $2 a beer for Kilt Lifter and many other local favorites. Outstanding value.   The bruschetta is amazing and I haven't tried one I haven't liked. The ricotta, smoked salmon, artichoke, Brie and prosciutto are a few of my go to's, but I seem to switch it up every time depending on my mood. They are great to share. Yum.  I branched out and tried the chicken salad for the first time in addition and wasn't overly impressed. I think I'll stick to what they do best here from now on.

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Highland - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Beer, bruschetta and chicken salad

OGmx-1atzIFJz9i0-1cFCw.text: Ended up here on Sunday for a pretty decent lunch. We both ordered the Turkey Pannini on Ciabatta bread. It was a good tasting sandwich, but it contained two slices of turkey and that turkey was not the best quality. It also could have been pressed more on the machine. The side of chips were out of the bag, but the side salad which contained raspberry and some cheese and leafy greens and walnuts was pretty good. The Bellini was only $5 and that had a nice refreshing taste, while all glasses of wine are also only $5 until 5pm. Very young crowd now that school is back in session. Probably will stick to the Brushetta if we return.

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Highland - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lacking turkey

9IR88KbAwZZNXDyg_w3K6A.text: Delicious. Delicious. Delicious.  Would like 1. Full bar 2. More light 3. More attentive servers Other than that, the food was great and ambience was very nice despite the fact I felt blind.  Prosciutto and Fig bruschetta was excellent. Butcher block to start was plenty for four. I should mention it  seems extremely casual, almost like home for some. I saw one guest with her shoes off and her bare feet up on her seat. Ew. C'mon.

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Highland - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Butcher block. Kinda dark.. but there Is literally no light in here!!!

Dq80Qo4ArggV6lsTKDWZTw.text: Best postino location! The staff are friendly, wait times are shorter and the server thats also a sommelier is so sweet, informative and knowledgeable!! Great food as always!

OQ_80vHlzzqDWcCreF09ow.text: Really good wine selection and bruschetta boards! The sandwiches are also really good. I will definitely be coming back, especially for the happy hour specials!

eD8LP6cxSrkqEGpqbBIJjw.text: It's a great looking spot in a reclaimed midcentury building just to the north of Fashion Square Mall, and Safari Drive.  I feel the simplicity of this concept is evolving and not as simplistic as when the first Postino's  opened on Central. I am not complaining, it's still a very clean menu, with sandwiches salads a soup a few cheesy appetizers and of course the bruschetta. We also had the brunch menu to choose from and it looked yummy!  Everything I tasted was tasty especially my salad with pears, pecans and gorgonzola. I was a little underwhelmed by the bruschetta, and at $15.00 it seemed a little small.  Service was Clunky, yet friendly and professional. The issue I noticed was 2 servers were in service sequence back to back. It seemed like one didn't know someone had started the table, and then returned again to mimic the other servers sequence of service.  The walnut tables are beautiful however drinks were served without napkins or coasters and our table was wet all over the place. I finally mentioned the issue to our server and a cocktail napkin was deliverd to me only, and then removed with the next Ice tea refill.  It's a great concept with a pretty good perceived value. Check this spot out, and I will be back as well.

13Lp68hq6sHtxx2SckiWNA.text: Awesome food, awesome service. Could tell our waitress was busy but she still checked in on ya and made sure we had everything we needed. Love happy hour! ;) Will defiantly be back.

8in_wdTsZtmkLu7zE1YFLQ.text: A really nice place to hang out.  Friendly people and good food and drinks.

3jh1a1yblUUQ7iGEHcXQnw.text: I agree with the first reviewer, what's not to love?! Postino has some of the yummiest food around and I'm excited to have an additional location nearby. :) Service is great - I had a wonderful experience with Tessa and the hostess that day even ran after me when I left my sunglasses behind on the table. Truly appreciate the good people and good food! Will be back often!

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Highland - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bruschetta board with smoked salmon, burrata and bacon, Apple and Brie, and artichoke dip

F_yTkOHrazRMZxahMf50Gw.text: I've always been a huge fan of the postino on Campbell... they have moved the same excellent food and service to Scottsdale Rd next to the Fashion Square mall.  Had a lovely lunch there. My only complaint was that the noise got a little loud towards the end of the lunch...but otherwise excellent.

OLJdgT_57qGu7bpK91UYaw.text: Great ambiance and plenty of food options. I actually found my favorite wine here too!

8xRzTfLwYEACE8c8Gs-b7Q.text: I recently relocated from Charlotte, NC to Scottsdale, AZ a few weeks ago, and the hospitality I have experienced from Raul S. and his staff has been beyond spe. The after 8pm wine and bruschetta specials are on point. I'm so glad I found this gem! Cheers

km-Lf9L7KiopD0DAI5oMvg.text: What's not to love? They certainly have a recipe for success - same delicious food, same great service, same awesome beer and wine options, great new location.  We came for their soft opening, and it was a wonderful evening. The cheese board and bruschetta boards were on point. Naturally, I had myself some lovely bellinis and the main squeeze had some yummy dark beer. The only downside to the evening was that they didn't yet have a couple of the beers on the menu. My fiance had to order 3 times because every beer he ordered was not in stock yet. However, you can't really find fault with that since literally 3 days ago this place still had no windows and no interior. They got everything up and running overnight!  New favorite spot for an easy date night. Plus, it's right next to my salon so I'm probably going to have some bubbly here before I get my hair cut next :)

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Highland - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Half eaten bruschetta board... Roasted pepper with goat cheese, tomato jam with cheese, prosciutto with fig and mascarpone.

CHZjHXD0dOVvsNfWJSuNuA.text: Very casual, atmosphere- great happy hour pricing. The wine list is awesome. The food is okay, nothing special but I still really enjoy the vibe here. I would recommend sitting on the back patio, it's perfect in the spring !!

9e4TK2zegZvSYiNo2_ZSQg.text: We stopped in for lunch and found the right place. I split the bruschetta with my daughter. Each piece is cut into 4 for easy sharing. We had mozzarella with tomato and basil, prosciutto with figs and marscapone, warm artichoke and burratta, bacon arugula and tomato. I cannot pick a favorite. I'd also like to try a few other choices. My husband had the Autostrada and found it to be tasty and not heavy. We need to return to try other options.

cJRK9FL_DIIbNMNZpHPFAA.text: This place is absolutely amazing. Every time I come here it exceeds expectations. The food is always amazing. The service is what really sets this place apart. The manager really knows how to make you feel welcome and our server Claudia made our meal really special.

-GHyBfIuSxSTx_x2uF4Prw.text: This place continues to impress me every time I come here! The service was 10 times better than when we first came here when it opened! Get the Brie a bracuto sandwich it's so good!

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Highland - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. This place is amazing and always impresses me!

6K-_p0kfmadxB8MCUkIDSA.text: I recently celebrated my birthday here and overall had a great experience. I like that you are able sit indoors or outdoors (though all of the outdoor tables were reserved for happy hour so make sure you make a reservation!) our server misunderstood my order but was very quick to correct it. He was extremely nice as was the hostess. This is one of my favorite restaurants because of the food and wine selection as well as the prices. I highly recommend visiting!

6w4HpGfCwUzNucgADCBXXg.text: I love this place so much! coolest atmosphere, awesome decor, and quality dining experience! truth be told I have only come here for the "bottle and board" special they run Monday and Tuesday after 8:00; its $20 for any bottle of wine and a board of bruschetta!  (some bottles alone can cost $50 without special)  I bring anyone who visits from out of town here, so far all have loved this location!

awkeix_15LEi8i9pwFqeRA.text: I found this place during a detailed search for a hip and classy destination where I could find great food and drinks. I wasn't sure what I was in for, but I chose this place after a long hard look at my options. Needless to say, I found exactly what I was looking for! There was a mix of younger and older crowds. The design of the locations was fabulous and intriguing. Now to the most important part of any restaurant experience: the service. Might i say impeccable!? The server was spot on with my extraordinary and specialized order, but she was also on top of my water and wine refills before i could even ask! I'll be back next time I'm in town, no doubt. Not to mention i will recommend this to many of my local friends

utDkAtYGcG7Hk8V7-x36dg.text: I'm not so happy with postinos at the moment but it does not regard their food so I will give it 5 stars simply because I love their bruschetta board.  I believe Mon and Tues you get a wine bottle and board for only 20 bucks.  I love mix and matching between sweet and salty choices.  My all time favorite is probably salmon because you can never go wrong with that but there is a fig pistachio one which is also really good.  I like the atmosphere and the servers are usually pretty good and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Highland - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bruschetta Board
Photo of Postino Highland - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bruschetta Board

cKCot_HetV-L18sPt0obmA.text: Great service, great food, and great wine selection! The ambience is perfect for a casual night with friends or a first date. Just moved to Scottsdale a week ago and have already been tw

L2sPXxzmtQTXKcg9fyR1Jw.text: My friends and I visited Postinos for my birthday dinner. Our waitress was Marissa and she was fabulous. Very bright and cheery with great recommendations. I would highly recommend this place! The food and wine were great and we all left very satisfied!

H7Z-X3lRPPqTP9KCMxIb9g.text: This was our first time to this location, and everything was great. There was plenty of parking unlike the other locations, and the patio was really nice! Our server Aaron helped us pick a bottle of red and even let us try a few samples before choosing. The food was great as always, we love the bruschetta! Definitely returning to this spot soon.

svAUnBuUhp9fZ1LYSTNGjQ.text: Came at 5:15 looking forward to HH; nope- HH ends at 5pm because they  "encourage day drinking".  Bummer, so we went somewhere else.

bBHvM6rwaCbik3Jca_bb1w.text: Amazing! The food was excellent and the staff is knowledgeable and courteous. The manager, Chip, was especially attentive and made sure we had a perfect experience. We came to celebrate Father's day and will surely be back real soon. Cheers, Postino's. Keep up the great work!

HPCBvkqr1NR4khA8MK5bhg.text: Went in for Sunday brunch and everything turned out perfect besides 10 minute wait on beverages every time. Atmosphere was excellent!

oNGEShX8jq06aFHgaC9iKA.text: The food is very good but the piped music is so loud it is difficult to have a conversation. We went for brunch and loud music on a Sunday morning was nerve-jangling.

FRTW6KIVgHZV1akTsunTgg.text: My meal tonight was amazing. The service was so fast! I ordered bruschetta which was fantastic! I did the three tasting flight  which was pretty dry but then ordered a glass and my glass of tarima was perfect. The tasting was Chilean which was exciting to try! Postino has always been my favorite and the HIGHLAND Store has really impressed me.

XRSz2qHFIvp660AVdWjl3g.text: My husband and I love Postino and live in Old Town Scottsdale. We were really excited to visit this location and invited friends to join us last night for wine and bruschetta. I read the reviews and thought people were being picky about the music. NOT SO! The music is painfully loud and I was uncomfortable the second I walked in. We arrived at 7pm and there was plenty of parking and only 1 couple near the hostess stand milling about so I thought JACKPOT! We'll get a table quick. There were literally 3 empty booths right by the door and a few tables with hand written Reserved signs on them. Imagine my shock when the hostess said 35-40 minute wait! Probably a godsend because I was already sick of the music, but shouldn't there be a ton of people around if it takes 40 minutes to get a table on Saturday night? I'm still trying to connect the dots? Anyhoo. We left. Not going back until future reviewers say the volume control on the radio is working again and wait times match the number of people waiting on a table.

rI2CavrXFV8pHE-KHiiUdQ.text: It was fine. Wait was WAYYYYY long. I wouldn't say it was worth the wait, brunch was average. Not bad, not great. Eggs were lukewarm and walnut toast was slightly burnt. It was a central location for four of us to meet though and once we were seated we had a great visit.  A little customer service training (smile and greet people, check back on the table once in awhile!) would go a long way, but that's True of most places these days.

aaHx3flCf0YFFHZ8jTk9zw.text: Mark was our server for our Sunday brunch today. He was the most knowledgeable srrver I've ever had dining out. He made great recommendations and provided exceptional service for me, my girlfriend and her brother. We've been waiting to visit this location and it lived up to all of our expectations. Mark was very attentive and really made the experience worthwhile, we even stayed for an additional 2 rounds of drinks after eating our food because of how well he treated us. We can't wait to come back to this Postino!

iSj845VyC-_zGxqf_UkEkA.text: Another Home Run !! Wonderful staff and great food. You thinking of opening a business, follow their business plan. Each location runs like clockwork. An awesome experience each time at every location !! An absolute pleasure. Juliana, Jordan,Emma.and Jeff were great as was Chip the manager.. Doing yourself a disservice if you don't come in !!

EKEwOx_hC0X4i3NEBhN-0w.text: Came here for the $20 bruschetta and bottle of wine night. There's so many options of bruschetta that you can chose from/mix and match which is nice. I've seen a few reviews complain about music being too loud but I didn't agree. I loved the old school R&B. The restaurant has a nice atmosphere; dark and candle lit. It was very romantic. I would recommend it for a date night. The service was good. But keep in mind, this is not a place where you can expect to get your food right away. Expect at least 25 minutes after ordering. This was completely fine for my boyfriend and I. It gave us time to enjoy our wine and talk. We may make this Monday and Tuesday deal a weekly ritual because we loved it so much.

Ufg7Ug4WZrzBoM0I3q-l4g.text: Another great Postino's in a wonderful venue. Same great food, wine, beer & service. Even has pkg (unlike LGNO)!!! Craig  & Lauren have a great formula!

bRnasMoLmwvS2uNBfKYM1Q.text: Never go to this location. We ordered to go bruschetta 2.5 hrs in advance and the manager was extremely rude and denied our request for gluten free bread said they didn't have enough. And complained that we didn't give enough notice. Unacceptable customer service.

H3YqaniIJCagUy0AJAU3dg.text: Last Friday I got off of work (as another member of the industry) and met some friends at the new Postinos on Scottsdale rd. First of all I LOVE Postinos- I have frequented the Arcadia location and recently went into the Kierland location where I received great service. The food never disappoints. Last Friday I received terrible service. I was on the patio and the server was a female with brown hair and I wish I got her name because whoever owns the franchise cannot want someone like that working for them. She was genuinely annoyed at the thought of doing anything for us. I am very forgiving of servers who get busy or have bad nights because I have been there but this was just a miserable experience. I arrived a little after the others and asked for water- the server never brought it so I asked someone else. She actually never came to the table after I arrived for a solid 15 minutes in the first place. Finally when she did come I ordered everything because the other members of my party said she was not reliable. I got an appetizer and an entree - they just came out at the same time. She genuinely looked disgusted by us every time we interacted with her. I still am giving this 3 stars because I love the food and next time I'm in hopefully we get better service.

GbEt9lduVafj4-cHgxFdjw.text: Finally visited the famous postinos for Friday date night. We arrived at 6:30 and were seated by 7:10. It took a while for a waitress to address our table.  The crowd was very young, loud and rowdy. I would prefer the Arcadia or Kierland location for an older crowd. Wine selection was great, bruschetta board was superb! We also ordered a panini and salad.. Wasn't crazy about the chicken mozzarella panini or the Hanahs field salad. We also ordered the lava cake for dinner which was yummy, but my husband said it tasted like pure cocoa powder to him... Overall pretty good. We will try the brunch next time, see if that tickles our fancy lol

7vU_4At2htHsqkGVsMmQww.text: Marisa Cluff killed it again with the serving! We love coming to Postino! Everyone is so friendly and the wine and bruschetta are amazing

xs9dMT7Hs9ezzIv4OavnuA.text: Pretty good establishment the food was great but not the best and the music was too loud. Really, the music is just too loud for casual conversation. I thought the choices for bruschetta was great lots of options had great choices of many different flavors, but the bruschetta I had at a local competitor it was better.   Had I not been to that other restaurant I probably would have like this one a lot better. Out of respect for Postino I will not mention who that competitor was. Overall we had a great experience the food is not overpriced as on the menu were sandwiches soups and appetizers but all in all had a great time. I would come back.

y8lxtW7w9N1Y-DGfXE2mKA.text: I've been to the Gilbert Location and the Camelback location as well. This location was very disappointing. I'm soooo glad that I didn't take a customer there or book this for our executives. There was bird feces everywhere out back. We sat out back and I felt like I was sitting in bird droppings all around me. I was disgusted. We moved inside because the sun was blinding us and it was so dirty. It was much cleaner inside; however, the service was not good (a young gal with long dark hair). We received our food and our waitress never came to ask us if we needed anything or how everything was. Another gal, with long dark hair, did give us a refill..... which when she filled a glass of iced tea, it ran onto the floor and she never came back to wipe it up.  We finally had to ask someone to get our check. On a good note, the food was really great, just very disappointed in the cleanliness and service. Hope this helps.

4GY7KI182Sbpq3wQUeNFPQ.text: My wife and I enjoy going to this location because it is close to home and have found the quality similar to other Postino's in the area.  We often go for happy hour and order the Butcher Block (an appetizer consisting of various meats, cheeses, olives, nuts and hummus) to enjoy with our wine.  In the past we have always found the food fresh with a wonderful presentation.  The last couple of times it seemed kind of slapped together and did not seem as fresh. We are wondering if the chain is growing too fast, or they are taking on a more corporate culture since they are now have so many locations.  We still enjoy going but are concerned that one of our favorite places is losing some of its charm.

npGzfLfWD5XJwFIsFXGw_w.text: The chicken and mozz sandwich is insane. Spicy and amazing. The boards are out of control. The service was great. Perfect amount of attention to our order and our drinks. The staff is knowledgeable, friendly and seem happy to be working.

_9dNSYXCYKlLKkQ_fF0-7w.text: Having a wonderful time at postino tonight. Great service and food! As a former restaurant general manager was very impressed with the staff. Ameya our server was amazing! Recommeded and explained the rose' and explained the tasting for us. One gentleman (I think his name was Raul. I hope I'm right on that) was exceptional. I'm thinking he was the manager. Helping out anywhere needed. Definitely recommending this location!

iaS4iG3dzq4OA0Qt9SVzbw.text: If you want the best French toast ever, this is the place! Great ambience, excellent service.   A wonderful way to spend a Saturday morning having brunch. This is my favorite place for brunch.  They are consistent and never disappoint......

KOYx8s61bAIeDotdWxdpyQ.text: Feeling a bit speechless. I just had one of the best service experiences from a restaurant I have ever had in my life. I had come here, not been served right away, yelped a negative review about it, and was located by the general manager of the restaurant within forty five minutes later... Yes, you read that right...I have NEVER had much respect for  managers at restaurants from experience of working at a restaurant, but wow. Employees must feel lucky to be working for Chip (GM), as he is someone I would want to work for. This restaurant has completely changed my perspective on customer service at restaurants and how a place can be completely the opposite of your first impression. FABULOUS food, but you should come here for the service alone. Thank you Postino for a genuinely memorable experience.

4bV27lAQGVmJukl4FYbtqw.text: I love Postinos! Especially their $20 board and wine. Everyone is always so nice and attentive, so service was great. Only thing is that the wait time is long, but definitely worth it for how good the food and service is!

6mub_AcCZ1uXB2NOTcRmvA.text: This was my first time at this location and I will certainly be returning. My friends and I went to get dinner before heading to a show. The staff, food, drinks were incredible. Highly recommend the Brie and apple with fig spread bruschetta.

m1J3qUjpRvh90TVQ3WxvaQ.text: Great ambience, decor, outdoor patio and outstanding music.  They are known for their bruscetta and happy hour.  The bruscetta choices are great but have tried the bruscetta twice, with inventive combos.  Brunch was excellent with homemade rasberry jam and walnut toast.  Great service!

eb4c6hHvUJGY_3KKYtcCQQ.text: I live nearby and go to Sachi for my hair so I find myself at Postinos in Old town often. I will admit when it first opened I found it to be a little bit lack luster.... however, recently I have fallen in love with it. The service has been so impressive that it has become my number one spot to bring clients and friends to! Raul checked in with us and accommodated my client who not only has a nut allergy but a SEED allergy. Customer service is such a lost art in this town but Raul goes above and beyond. I'm so grateful I live close to such a great spot.

Aa_D9uwwkgsbXRiawUwEnw.text: I started eating at Postino when they first opened on 40th & Campbell. The food is consistently great and I have never had a bad experience ever!  The choices of wine and menu items are great although I order the same thing every time!  It's fun to have 4 choices for every bruschetta that you order.  I love them all and couldn't recommend one more than another!  It's a great choice no matter what location you choose!

oott2Ikfk4WKw3xfzbohtA.text: I really enjoy this place.  I love the atmosphere and fun time when I go. The bottle and board nights are my favorite. Everyone always friendly and helpful.

9ZI8uYjQcnLEg0GlfI_Bow.text: Food and drinks are awesome. Plus $5 pitchers or glasses of wine before 5, can't beat that. However tonight when my friend and I were enjoying our dinner and wine, our server was just rude. She ignored our table pretty much the whole time. She had a stink face on the whole time and didn't even check in on us after we got our food. Thankfully the manager rectified the situation in order to get the restaurant my 4 star rating.

rivfmqH0CWHTDa42dLendA.text: Came here unexpectedly and left full and happy. We thought there would be pasta options on the menu,but was surprised when there wasn't. That didn't stop us from having a delicious dinner. The bruschetta was amazing. Our favorite were the original tomato, basil, and mozzarella. I also had the chicken pesto panini, yum yum yum soo good! The Brussel sprout salad was beyond amazing! Def be coming back!

wD-ZOS_DXRFOmuC5biBuBQ.text: I usually never have anything bad to say about the service when going out to eat but this was the absolute worst service i've ever had from our server Randi...I waited 20 minutes before we got our order in until a different server had to come take our order, our server did not seem very friendly when we would ask to order something else, we had to wait 15 minutes to order drinks and then an additional 20 min once our joiners came and sat down.

9lclxZlPxpKEpRzJxfAGdQ.text: Great service, great atmosphere and great food!  I absolutely love their bruschetta. Very good assortment of bruschetta choices and fresh ingredients. Today I indulged in dessert and ordered their chocolate lava cake (it was called boushon or something like that). That was pretty awesome. It was very good and light. They don't overdo it in the portion size of dessert. Just enough. The music isn't loud but I find myself m singing to many great songs.

pTKS-tgeOcUDv_b5Xm14WQ.text: Marisa was an amazing server. We had a great experience at Postinos for my friends birthday. We loved all of our food! We will for sure be back and ask for Marisa!

oSDA8zU6TswBkkSDXyHzKA.text: My fiance and I came in for brunch yesterday and it was delicious. We sat at the bar which was very busy but everyone was very attentive and great! My fiance isn't much of a wine drinker but liked the beer selection and we were impressed with the happy hour pricing. We will definitely be back!

DwsNxKkKFZYHc1pN6t33hg.text: Great service. The atmosphere and attitude in this place is always great. They always have the best wines and bruschetta is great. A+

zBJzMaaOpHq_ICG5lrMKhA.text: I have to tell you lately we've been going to Postino's Highland and there is the most amazing bartender slash server Derek that is so personable and definitely easy to remember. His service is always so knowledgeable and friendly. He is definitely the reason why we come into this Postino's. We have frequent other Postino's but by far his service is superior of all. The bruschetta board is amazing and the meat and cheese board is to die for. Thank you Derek for all your amazing service we hope to see you soon. Chris Birkett and Sarah squared. :-)

-l2WN9lGDl_TVmDFodb0rA.text: So I came in yesterday right before happy hour was over. I love that postino has wine on special all day.. I had been into this location a few times but have never sat at the bar. I sat at the bar and the bartender that helped me was Derek. He was so attentive. He offered me a wine called verdicchio. Omg it was so good. I have never had a wine like that. I also noticed he helped a lady that looked like she had a bit too much to drink to her taxi.. such a nice guy. The whole experience was awesome and I love the chicken mozzarella panini. I'll be back soon and with friends

f8TZf44kbMFs5aP5Ni8YRQ.text: Postino was one of the first recommendations I received when I moved to Phoenix - for good reason! They have a killer $20 deal that includes a bottle of wine and Bruschetta on Monday and Tuesday after 8pm. Surprisingly, I don't come to Postino for the wine, but for the Bruschetta. I'm more of a beer gal myself and there's $5 pitchers of beer during Happy Hour plus Bruschetta for the same price. (Also, for my fellow native East Coasters, they have Brooklyn Beer on tap! I nearly fainted when I saw it, this is one of my favorite brews, so it's easy to get your beer fix on here even amongst the wino's).  Back to the infamous $20 deal- it's simply Arizona locals' favorite because the Bruschetta is large. If you're picturing tiny little pieces of bread, no, magnify it to Arizona size- they are huge. Not only that, but the ingredients are very fresh. I've ordered both savory and sweet and they are all great. If I had to pick a few to order, I'd say I always re-order the Sweet & Spicy Pepper Jam with Goat Cheese as well as the Ricotta with Dates & Pistachios. I can't think of another occasion where I can have spicy jam on bread with goat cheese, but at Postino's I can, and it's delicious.  In addition to their fare, the ambience is great, too. There are little details at Postino like the matchboxes on the wall that span decades, the neon yellow "Weird is Rad" sign and brightly lit chandeliers by the bar. And at this particular location, the restaurant used to be a bank in the 60's, originally designed by Frank Lloyd Wright's apprentice.  Oh Postino I've already hit up the Central and Highland locations, now I'm on to circling the next.

5AjF0ii31TrkADyIWthgrw.text: Had a large group of people come out for a going away party. The manager (Raul) was completely unwilling to accommodate an extra chair for an extra person in a reservation of 12. So much so that they said if that person wanted to dine we could leave because the outside chairs would "ruin their floor". After spending a couple hundred dollars here as a group I would not recommend dining here with a large party as they do not care about accommodating their customers.

5LN8iPF69ECfUEkbioGLgw.text: One of the cutest little places in Scottsdale hands down! The vibes and the atmosphere are beautiful and the food and drinks are delicious! Loved the match wall and the fun holiday decor. You must come here for a drink and app!

8uJAIfIR6AnvsSj8zgTXMg.text: I love the new additions to the menu. We really enjoyed the steak skewers and the addition of the wonderful Cesar salad. The pesto is my favorite and I love the bruschetta. The patio is perfect right now.

glBjzLBWLF-8GZh9e_b4CA.text: Thought we'd try the postinos in Scottsdale. First off, it's Scottsdale so you know you're going to deal with people who feel they are better than you. That being said, ordered a pitcher (their pitchers are the American style only 2 beers)  of beer which was the worst pour I've seen with 30% head and i never complain about too much head unless it's my beer. When i mentioned this to the staff, they informed us, the customer that we're wrong, and that it was mandated to pour with a lot of head..... thanks for telling me how to "pour" a beer. This is the last time I'll let Postinos pour my beer.

i0tFWebdzX0buZM72QOLIg.text: I Like Postino for business lunches. i have had several here and always great food, quick service and a good place to work. The brussels sprout salad is great with some amazing cheese on top. Love their iced tea too!

m-pvh0u6t0p8CxmebX3gog.text: Mondays & Tuesdays $20 bottle & board deal? Need I say more? Absolutely love the chill vibe on the outside patio. My favorite way to beat the Monday blues with my girlfriends. Our server was so prompt and friendly, with a continuous smile on her face. I noticed the table next to us brought their adorable dogs so I'm assuming it's pet-friendly, in the outside seating. Love this new location, I would definitely be returning very soon.

aKUyCkbj9QB2PHlpX0h5RA.text: Oh how I miss this place!  I sure wish they would come to Georgia!!   My daughter and I enjoyed the bruschetta (a must when you dine here) and the raspberry chicken salad.  $5 wine before 5 every single day of the week?   #heaven.  Beautiful outdoor patio at this location - can't go wrong here.  Keep it up Postinos.

aVAZEBXkiyILic-H-Qmz_w.text: It's hot out.  Hot like the surface of Venus.  That said the patio here is great for the summer.  There is a ton of shade thanks in part to an enormous tree and numerous umbrellas.  The misters help too.    If you've been in the valley for more than a week you've probably been to Postino several times so the food and drink selections should be familiar.  I've never thought their food was great but the atmosphere and the drink specials ($5 pitchers of craft beer before 5PM!!) are tremendous.  This location is newer than the rest but everything else will feel familiar.

olraycacwBq55ji--lss3g.text: Beautiful and delicious. Hubby and I went out for a date. We were looking for tapas and wandered to Scottsdale. Impressed by the Bruchetta Board my children and I enjoyed at the Tempe location, I was eager for my husband to enjoy the experience as well.   Postino is a semi-outdoor, open concept. Even though it was hot on the outside, with the misters, it felt surprisingly cool.  We were ushered to a table immediately by our lovely hostess. Our attentive server took care of us, providing careful service that was not overbearing.   I enjoyed my refreshing Bellini ($5 everyday/all the time). Hubby ordered a Pilsner on tap that stayed cold through the evening.   We ordered 2 Bruschetta Boards ($15 each). You select from a list of toppings. They organized the Bruchetta from mildest flavors to most robust. Board 1: Brie and Green Apple with preserves, Prosciutto with figs, Smoked Salmon with Pesto, Burrata and Bacon. Board 2: Warm artichoke, Pistachio and date, Pesto Salami and Seasonal: Romanesco and cauliflower. This was a feast for the senses. The boards are colorful, packed with flavor and textures. Our favorites were the well balanced Brie, green apple and preserves combination that balanced sweet, savory and tart. The smoked salmon was delicate, accented by the pesto and capers. We were surprised by the Romanesco cauliflower combination. We liked the textures of the roasted corn and cauliflower on the Romanesco backdrop. We thought the weakest combinations were the Warm artichoke and the Pistachio Date pairings. They were not bad, just not outstanding.  Thank you, Postino, for a lovely dining experience. I did not disappoint my Honey with this recommendation.

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Highland - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Romantic Ambience
Photo of Postino Highland - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bruschetta Board: Burrata Bacon, Smoked Salmon with Pesto, Prosciutto with Figs, Brie and Apples
Photo of Postino Highland - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bruschetta Board: Romesco with cauliflower, Pesto Salami, Pistachio with dates, and Warm Artichoke

sVaRZxURtexfy0bKtlL0zQ.text: Loved their brushchetta board!!! Lots of different flavors and combinations to choose from but they're all so yummy i can't wait to try them all! The ricotta with dates and pistachio was probably my favorite! Very light and sweet. We also ordered the smoked salmon with pesto, the prosciutto with figs and mascarpone and the sweet and spicy pepper jam with goat cheese! Also the cucumber honey lemonade was probably one of the best lemonades I've ever had... And wines and other beverages for $5 before 5 whhhattt. The restaurant itself was also very aesthetically pleasing and the wait staff made sure we were enjoying our lunch. We will definitely be back!
